author: checkpoint
title: Checkpoint Content Hub
description: Despite all the great things the Cardano blockchain, there are few solutions to the acquisition, retention and servicing of audiences

f6_assessments.q0:
This is a proposal for the creation of an online magazine with the idea trough that media to educate non blockchain natives trough the lens of videogames. 
The problem presented is the lack of acquisition and retention of audiences. 
The proposed solution is education tough learning materials, video, audio and other content. The key is to be specifically tailored for videogamers who are interested in blickchain and adopting it.
Maybe the connection with the challenge here is that this could be a metaverse hub, but I don’t find it particularly well explained. Checkpoint is the platform that the proposer wants to leverage for bringing the content to the users http://www.checkpointhub.info/ .  Looks good and futuristic.
Unfortunately I’m not completely sure if this qualifies for a Cardano Hub, given that the hubs are local  and serve people that otherwise don’t have access to the blockchain world.
On the other hand a metaverse hub will be very effective due to the small price per user acquisition.
I neither agree nor disagree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal does not present a plan or a timeline for the development of this project. The only thing we have is Q4 for creation of the launch of  a Checkpoint Hub/Blockchain focused gaming magazine.
The proposer states that they will produce 1 magazine a quarter with a review at the end of the year to see if there is demand for more.
The proposer presents some kind of a budget breakdown but without much detail. Working hours and remuneration per hour, per profession are missing.
What is important to be pointed out is that the biggest expense is for content creation.
The proposer explains that the magazine will create own revenue by advertising. Projections are for  $20K for the first year and $500K for the third year.
The team of two is presented but they did not link to their CVs and it took me some digging to find them for the voter to review if needed. https://www.linkedin.com/in/tamer-asfahani-622b2314/?originalSubdomain=uk and https://www.linkedin.com/in/paul-elmes-3258a2b/?originalSubdomain=uk
The team looks well qualified to achieve the objectives of this proposal (creation of the e-magazine that is, I could not say about the advertising revenue projections.)
The only reason that I’m tipping in the direction of feasibility is that the framework is build and ready, and this proposal is just for content creation.
I agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The auditability part is nonexistent. Since the proposer does not provide any milestones with exact numbers attached and a timeline, the only way to audit this proposal will be at the end, when and if the magazine is out and measure the use of the magazine.
The success measurable are not presented.
I strongly disagree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Arousing curiosity about blockchain and Cardano through an in-game experience is a practical idea, it's really approachable, everyone loves to have fun. If the project is focused and on the right track, the Cardano community will grow very quickly, due to the 350k members available from Checkpoint, which is a huge resource. As for the project's challenge, good game content and attractive graphics will solve the problem. At the same time, to increase interaction between members, it is recommended to create a social channel for everyone to discuss
f6_assessments.q1: The project plan needs to be listed in more detail, the team will stay on track and the community can follow the development of the project. The plus point of this proposal is that advertising costs can be collected, helping the project to grow and sustain itself. Members should provide additional links to social channels for community interaction. And I think you need more advisory members with blockchain expertise to make things work better
f6_assessments.q2: The project should introduce more quantitative indicators during development so that the community can consider, for example, number of participants, game look, popular content, downloads, number of ads …The success of the project will help people know more about Cardano, converting the number of people interested in blockchain.

f6_assessments.q0: The name of this project is Checkpoint, which proposes a new way of educating and onboarding people that are interested with blockchain using new media outlets (magazines), which talks about video games usage e.g Metaverse and AR. Using this medium, it will help younger audience that are interested in video games and blockchain to learn more about Cardano and blockchain in general, thus increasing user adoption in the future. This interactive content already has over 350,000 engaged users on Checkpoint platform.
f6_assessments.q1: The team have a relevant and long experience within the topic of journalism, which is great for creating this educational magazine. They’ve also have a checkpoint magazine already in App Store and Google Play (https://checkpointmagazine.com/magazine/). This indicate that the team have the knowledge necessary for making this proposal a success. The budget is provided, however it would be great to break it down for each allocation area. Such as: $10,000 for three issues- describe the expected work hours, allocation for covers, the design, and articles. This would give us an idea on how the budget will be used. The roadmap could be provided in more specific rather than Q4 of 2022, and with that also give a goal target for each quarter, also within each month (the progress, deliveries with the design and cover, etc.) Overall, a great and well written project, it could be better with the budget break downs and detailing its roadmap.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics and KPIs is somewhat provided, however it’s too general and too broad. Consider making a target number of download for the first quarter magazines issue, say, 500 downloads. That way, the community can expect the exact target or goals with the project. All in all, since this is already in App Store and have their website, the community could see their progress over time.

solution: To utilise and educate non-blockchain natives through the lens of videogames by releasing specialist content across relevant channels
experience:
I've been a journalist for over 20 years and have come from a BBC and Guardian background - broadcast journalist (award winning) . My team are veterans in their relevant fields.

I have been in the games industry for over 15 years and have an already established audience.
